a satisfactory study can be made 
of the cause or causes producing 
them.
A few forms of <u>Hypolimnus <\u> have 
been selected to shew their bearing 
upon the Theory of Mimicry but 
Col. Swinhoe does not mention the 
fact that the largest & most conspicuous 
members of the genus appear to 
live quite independently of any 
protection derived from resemblance to 
common protected forms.
Again even in the case of <u>H. bolina <\u> Col 
Swinhoe has not traced it over nearly
